Text.Text: If you've come because Shawford told you to check on us, tell him we've almost got the trouble fixed, all right?
Eh?  What *now?*  We're working as fast as we can, all right?
You mean Shawford didn't send you?  All right, then - you can find him in the bunkhouse in the southeast compound.  Just keep heading east and you should run into it in no time.

Me?  That runt Olap?  Ha!  No, no - you can find that little biter in the northeast compound, patching the wall.  Hope he's all done with it, or else all the effort we've spent building this Palisade is useless.
You can find Isherwood just to the north of here.  Give him my regards and tell him not to worry - we've almost got this problem licked.
Well, now... it's this catapult.  Been giving us a little trouble is all, nothing we can't solve.
No, I'm *handling* it.  Now, look, you'd best get to your post.

Look - for the *last* time, this is no concern of yours.  I just need a proper hammer to drive a few nails back into the supports, and the matter will be settled.  Now get to your post now, or I'll report you, all right?
Yes, I *know* that, a simple hammer and the problem would be fixed in no time, but for the *last* time, this is no concern of yours.  Now get to your post now, or I'll report you, all right?
By the GODS, are those ears of yours just for show?!  I don't *want* a hammer, I don't want you to fetch me one, I want you to go about your business and *leave me to mine!*
I... all right.  I need the help, this damnable club is worthless for pounding nails in these supports.  So, yes, if you have a hammer, that'd be a help.
If you find one, then I'd welcome it.  Come back if you have one - else I'll just keep using this club and trying to pound these nails in.
I'll just need to borrow the hammer for a moment... oh, and you might want to take a few steps back.
DAMNABLE NAILS, MAKE A FOOL OF ME, WILL YOU?!  I'LL SMASH YOU INTO THE HELLS!  TAKE THIS!  AND THIS!  NOT SO SMART *NOW,* ARE YOU?  NOW STAY IN!  *STAY* IN!
Phew... hnh... hnh... all done.  Here's... your hammer... back.  Gods, I need a drink.
Me, build this piece of woodrot-infested junk?  No, I had no part of this - we built some of the other catapults in the compound, but this one we pulled from one of the merchant ships in the harbor.
Get OUT of here and may the hells go with you!  Go polish your blades, string your bows, or something *equally* worthless!
You again - what do *you* want?
Got that hammer yet?  I can't fix this catapult with my hands.

Look, please accept my thanks for your help - and accept my apologies to you for my rudeness.  Shawford's told us to "make do" with what we've got available, and I guess I got too caught up in his orders.
Actually, we're looking for the Commander of the Targos Guard.  Can you tell us where to find him?
Actually, we're just looking for an engineer named Olap.  Is that you?
Actually, we're looking for an archer captain named Isherwood.  Can you tell us where to find him?
What trouble?
I'll do that.  Did you build this catapult?
Uh, all right.  Farewell.
We're looking for the Commander of the Targos Guard.  Can you tell us where to find him?
We're looking for an engineer named Olap.  Can you tell us where to find him?
We're looking for an archer captain named Isherwood.  Can you tell us where to find him?
You mentioned you were having some trouble with that catapult.  Need any help with it?
You sure you don't need any help with that catapult?
Did you build this catapult?
Never mind, then.  Sorry to disturb you.  Farewell.
You mentioned something about trouble.  What's wrong?
You sure you don't need any help with that catapult?
Did you build this catapult?
I'll go see him, then.  Farewell.
You mentioned something about trouble.  What's wrong?
You sure you don't need any help with that catapult?
Did you build this catapult?
He can't be any worse than Ulbrec, but thanks for the warning.  Farewell.
You mentioned something about trouble.  What's wrong?
You sure you don't need any help with that catapult?
Did you build this catapult?
I'll go see him, then.  Farewell.
Need any help?
You sure you don't need any help?
Did you build this catapult?
I'll go see him, then.  Farewell.
That catapult arm needs some more support, or it's liable to snap the first time it's fired.  It looks like all you need to do is hammer those nails back in place.
That catapult arm needs some more support, or it's liable to snap the first time it's fired.  It looks like all you need to do is hammer those nails back in place.
That catapult arm needs some more support, or it's liable to snap the first time it's fired.  It looks like all you need to do is hammer those nails back in place.
We could pitch in, if you need some help.  It'd be our pleasure.
You don't *look* like you're handling it.
Did you build this catapult?
Very well.  Farewell.
Need a hammer?  I have one you can use.
Need a hammer?  I have one you can use.
Need a hammer?  I have one you can use.
Need a hammer?  I have one you can use.
We could go find you a hammer if you need one.
Did you build this catapult?
I'll take my leave, then.  Farewell.
Need a hammer?  I have one you can use.
Need a hammer?  I have one you can use.
Need a hammer?  I have one you can use.
We could go find you a hammer if you need one.
We could go find you a hammer if you need one.
Did you build this catapult?
I'll take my leave, then.  Farewell.
If the goblins attack and this catapult fails, you will be giving the field to the goblins.  If every dwarf across Faerun horded their tasks as stubbornly as you, our race would be extinct.
In gnomish communities, it is considered impolite to the rest of the community to hoard a problem to yourself... and criminal if such a problem could threaten the community as a whole.
In halfling communities, it is considered insulting to the rest of the community to hoard a problem to yourself... and criminal if such a problem could threaten the community as a whole.
Look... it looks like we can help you with your problem right now.  What if the goblins attack while this catapult is broken?
Your stubbornness makes little sense, especially if the goblins were to attack us at this moment.
Look, you've already done most of the work, and we don't have anything to do.  Why don't you let us pitch in?
Did you build this catapult?
I'll take my leave, then.  Farewell.
Of course - here.  It looks like pounding in those third and fifth nails should be enough.
Of course - here.  It looks like pounding in those third and fifth nails should be enough.
Of course - here.  It looks like pounding in those third and fifth nails should be enough.
Of course - here.  It looks like pounding in those third and fifth nails should be enough.
I don't have one, but we could go find one and bring it back.
Did you build this catapult?
We'll go hunt one down, then.  We'll return shortly.
Step back?  Why?
By the Gods!  Stop, man, stop!  You're killing them!
Calm down!  Save it for the goblins!
Whoa.  *Someone's* obviously married.
Uh, thanks.  Did you build this catapult yourself?
Great.  We'll be going now.  Good luck.
You might want to save some of that for the coming battle, friend.  Farewell.
You mentioned you were having some trouble with it.  Need any help with it?
You sure you don't need any help with it?
I see.  Thanks for the information.  Farewell.
Very well, if I cannot convince you, then I will take my leave.
The only worthless act I see around here is your laughable attempts to repair that catapult.  I hope Tymora is along soon to save you from your own mule-headed stupidity.
We're looking for the Commander of the Targos Guard.  Can you tell us where to find him?
We're looking for an engineer named Olap.  Can you tell us where to find him?
We're looking for an archer captain named Isherwood.  Can you tell us where to find him?
You mentioned you were having some trouble with that catapult.  Need any help with it?
You sure you don't need any help with that catapult?
Did you build this catapult?
Nothing.  Sorry to disturb you.  Farewell.
Of course - here you go.
Of course - here you go.
Of course - here you go.
Of course - here you go.
We're still looking.  We'll return when we've found one.
Not a problem; we're all here to help each other.  Farewell.
I care nothing for your apology.  Just watch your tone when speaking to us next time, or *you* might be the one who gets the hammer, not the catapult.
